meanings.definition: Firm or uncompromising in a position or viewpoint.
meanings.sent1: She took a hardline stance on the issue, refusing to consider any other options.
meanings.sent2: The manager's hardline decision left no room for negotiation.
meanings.sent3: The cat took a hardline approach to getting its favorite toy, refusing to play with anything else.
meanings.sent4: His hardline attitude towards punctuality was well-known among his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's hardline rule about no talking during exams was strictly enforced.

meanings.definition: Characterized by strict adherence to a particular set of beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: The community was known for its hardline commitment to environmental conservation.
meanings.sent2: Her hardline dedication to her craft earned her respect from her peers.
meanings.sent3: The hardline belief in the power of lucky socks led to an interesting fashion trend.
meanings.sent4: The hardline loyalty of the fans was evident in their unwavering support.
meanings.sent5: His hardline adherence to the daily routine never wavered, even on weekends.

meanings.definition: A strict or uncompromising policy or approach.
meanings.sent1: The government's hardline against illegal activities led to a decrease in crime rates.
meanings.sent2: The company's hardline on safety protocols ensured a secure work environment.
meanings.sent3: The hardline on dessert portions at the party left everyone craving more sweets.
meanings.sent4: Her hardline in negotiations made her a formidable opponent at the bargaining table.
meanings.sent5: The coach's hardline on punctuality set a standard of discipline for the team.
